algorithm.title: About Algorithm v6.0
algorithm.subtitle: Enhanced ranking system with innovation decay, platform risk modifiers, and revenue quality adjustments
algorithm.description: Our ranking algorithm combines quantitative metrics with qualitative assessments to provide a comprehensive view of AI coding tools. We update rankings weekly based on new data and continuously refine our methodology.

modifiers.decay: [TRANSLATE] Innovation Decay (6-month half-life) - Ensures recent innovations are weighted more heavily
modifiers.risk: [TRANSLATE] Platform Risk Modifier - Adjusts scores based on platform dependencies and lock-in
modifiers.revenue: [TRANSLATE] Revenue Quality Adjustment - Differentiates between sustainable and one-time revenue

algorithm.methodologyText: [TRANSLATE] Our comprehensive methodology evaluates AI coding tools across multiple dimensions, ensuring fair and accurate rankings that reflect real-world performance and adoption.

methodology.title: Our Methodology
methodology.subtitle: How we rank AI coding tools
methodology.intro: AI Power Rankings uses a sophisticated algorithm (v6.0) to evaluate and rank AI coding tools based on multiple quantitative and qualitative factors. Our methodology is designed to provide developers with an objective, data-driven assessment of the AI tools landscape.

scoringFactors.title: Scoring Factors
scoringFactors.intro: Our algorithm evaluates tools across 8 key dimensions, each weighted according to its importance to developers:

modifiers.title: Dynamic Modifiers
modifiers.intro: To ensure rankings reflect current market realities, we apply three sophisticated modifiers:

dataCollection.title: Data Collection
dataCollection.intro: We gather data from multiple sources to ensure accuracy:

sources.0: Direct API integrations with tool providers
sources.2: Industry reports and verified news sources

updateFrequency.title: Update Frequency
updateFrequency.content: Rankings are recalculated weekly to reflect the rapidly evolving AI landscape. Major methodology updates are versioned and documented.

algorithm.title: [TRANSLATE] Algorithm v6.0
algorithm.description: [TRANSLATE] Our latest ranking algorithm incorporates real-world usage patterns and market dynamics

features.innovationDecay: [TRANSLATE] Innovation decay modeling to reflect tool freshness
features.platformRisk: [TRANSLATE] Platform risk assessment for vendor dependencies
features.revenueQuality: [TRANSLATE] Revenue quality adjustments based on business model
features.technicalWeighting: [TRANSLATE] Technical capability weighting for different use cases

factors.title: [TRANSLATE] Scoring Factors
factors.description: [TRANSLATE] Tools are evaluated across 8 key dimensions with specific weightings

agentic.details: [TRANSLATE] Measures autonomous capabilities, multi-step reasoning, and complex task completion

innovation.details: [TRANSLATE] Evaluates breakthrough features, technical advances, and market differentiation
innovation.name: Innovation

performance.details: [TRANSLATE] Benchmarks on SWE-bench, HumanEval, and real-world coding tasks
performance.name: Performance
performance.description: Capacités de génération, complétion et débogage de code

adoption.details: [TRANSLATE] Active users, growth rate, and market penetration metrics
adoption.name: Adoption
adoption.description: Acceptation des utilisateurs et engagement communautaire

traction.details: [TRANSLATE] Revenue growth, funding rounds, and business momentum indicators

sentiment.details: [TRANSLATE] Developer satisfaction, community feedback, and recommendation scores

velocity.details: [TRANSLATE] Feature release cadence, update frequency, and innovation speed

resilience.details: [TRANSLATE] Platform stability, backup options, and vendor independence

modifiers.title: [TRANSLATE] Dynamic Modifiers
modifiers.description: [TRANSLATE] Real-time adjustments that reflect market conditions and tool maturity

innovationDecay.description: [TRANSLATE] Innovation scores decay over time to reward continuous improvement and penalize stagnation

platformRisk.description: [TRANSLATE] Adjustments based on vendor lock-in, platform dependencies, and business risks

revenueQuality.description: [TRANSLATE] Revenue weighting based on business model sustainability and growth potential

dataSources.title: [TRANSLATE] Data Sources & Validation
dataSources.description: [TRANSLATE] We maintain rigorous standards for data collection and validation

sources.api: [TRANSLATE] Direct API integrations with tool providers
sources.research: [TRANSLATE] Industry research reports and analyst data
sources.announcements: [TRANSLATE] Official company announcements and press releases

requirements.completeness: [TRANSLATE] All required metrics must be present
requirements.reliability: [TRANSLATE] Multiple source verification for key metrics

updateFrequency.title: [TRANSLATE] Update Schedule
updateFrequency.description: [TRANSLATE] Rankings are recalculated weekly with continuous data collection. Major algorithm updates are versioned and documented.

overview.title: Aperçu de l'évaluation
overview.description: Notre approche basée sur les données pour évaluer les outils de codage IA

about.title: About AI Power Rankings
about.subtitle: Empowering developers with data-driven AI tool insights

hero.title: Empowering developers with data-driven AI tool insights
hero.subtitle: We believe developers deserve transparent, objective rankings of AI coding tools to make informed decisions.

mission.title: Notre mission
mission.content: To provide the developer community with the most comprehensive, unbiased, and up-to-date rankings of AI coding tools, helping teams choose the right tools for their needs.
mission.description: Classements transparents et basés sur les données des outils de codage IA pour les développeurs

reasons.0: The AI tools landscape is evolving rapidly, making it hard to keep track
reasons.1: Marketing claims often don't match real-world performance
reasons.2: Developers need objective data to justify tool adoption
reasons.3: There was no single source comparing all major AI coding tools

team.title: L'équipe
team.description: Découvrez les personnes derrière AI Power Rankings
team.description1: [TRANSLATE] AI Power Ranking is maintained by Bob Matsuoka, a technology executive and fractional CTO who's been tracking agentic coding tools since March 2025.
team.description2: [TRANSLATE] I combine hands-on experience building production applications with systematic evaluation of AI development tools. This site provides the quantitative backbone for my strategic analysis at HyperDev, where I write about the practical realities of coding with AI agents.
team.description3: [TRANSLATE] Full transparency: this is a one-person operation built in two days. I'm shipping and iterating based on real usage because the developer tools landscape moves too fast for traditional analysis cycles.

points.3: Choose tools that fit your needs

paralysis.title: [TRANSLATE] Decision Paralysis
paralysis.description: [TRANSLATE] With dozens of AI tools launching every week, developers face overwhelming choices

marketing.title: [TRANSLATE] Marketing vs Reality
marketing.description: [TRANSLATE] Bold claims often don't match real-world performance and capabilities

change.title: [TRANSLATE] Rapid Change
change.description: [TRANSLATE] Tools evolve quickly - what's best today might be obsolete tomorrow

risks.title: [TRANSLATE] Hidden Risks
risks.description: [TRANSLATE] Security, privacy, and vendor lock-in concerns are often overlooked

whyItMatters.conclusion: [TRANSLATE] That's why we built AI Power Ranking - to cut through the noise and provide clear, data-driven insights.
